name: Thai Braised Pork & Egg | Marion's Kitchen
description: This dish takes me right back to my childhood – it’s just like a mum hug! Take pork belly up a notch by braising it in these rich, bold flavours until it’s soft, tender and brimming with umami goodness. Elevate the Asian flavours even more by using my homemade five spice. Delicious!
recipeIngredient: 700g (1.5 lb) skinless pork belly, cut into roughly 3 cm cubes
200g (7 oz) fried tofu, cut into bite-sized pieces

recipeInstructions.text: Step 1.Use a mortar and pestle to pound the garlic, coriander roots, peppercorns and salt to a rough paste.

Step 2.Heat the vegetable oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add the paste and cook for about a minute or until fragrant. Add the pork and cook until the pork starts to turn golden. Add the Chinese five spice, dark soy sauce, sugar, light soy sauce, star anise, tofu and 4 cups of water. Bring to the boil. Then turn the heat down to medium and gently simmer for 30 minutes. Then add the eggs and simmer for another hour until the pork is fork tender. Top with coriander. Serve with steamed rice.

publisher.name: Bring the Best Flavours of Asia to Home Kitchens
